Description: Iraq invades Kuwait leading to a sharp spike in oil prices due to supply fears.
Coalition forces begin combat operations; prices drop as quick victory becomes anticipated.
Currency crisis starting in Thailand leads to demand shock and lower oil prices.
OPEC and non-OPEC members agree to cut production to boost lingering low prices.
Terrorist attacks in the US cause immediate volatility and demand uncertainty.
US-led invasion of Iraq causes supply disruption concerns.
Oil prices reach all-time high of ~$147 before the financial crisis takes hold.
Bankruptcy of Lehman Brothers accelerates the Global Financial Crisis and oil price crash.
Unrest in MENA region particularly Libya disrupts supply and raises prices.
OPEC decides not to cut production despite shale boom leading to price crash.
OPEC and Russia agree to cut production ending the price crash.
Breakdown of OPEC+ talks leads to production surge and price collapse.
WHO declares COVID-19 a pandemic; lockdowns destroy global demand.
Russia invades Ukraine causing sanctions fears and supply shock.
